description: A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the northern island from the Japanese archipielago. Once revered yet feared in ancient Japan, the animal suffered a directed campaign of extermination during the 19th and early 20th centuries.  Similar in size to a North American wolf, both were considered to be close cousins before the Cataclysm, if not the same species only separated by geography.

description: A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the three southern islands from the Japanese archipielago. Once revered in ancient Japan, the animal suffered the consequences of human activities in modern times, not to mention the active persecution during the 19th and early 20th centuries.  Smaller than a North American wolf, it's still a wolf regardless.
